com.saliman.entitypruner
Interface Options

public interface Options

This interface defines the standard keys that can appear in an options map. These options effect things like pruning of objects, the rows per page to return on a find, etc.

There are 3 pruning options that the framework itself looks at, and are support by any application.

Options that relate to finding entities are standard options that applications should support, but whether or not a particular option works is up to implementing applications.

The actual values of each constant is the exact string that needs to be passed in by calling programs to use the option.

Author:
Steven C. Saliman

Field Detail

DEPTH

static final java.lang.String DEPTH
A depth options tells the entity populator and pruner to use a numeric depth in pruning. A depth of 1 means the object itself, 2 means the object and all of its children, etc.

This option is one of the 3 pruning options. If no pruning options are specified, the default is to return whatever the server loaded in the course of doing business.

See Also:
INCLUDE, SELECT, Constant Field Values

INCLUDE

static final java.lang.String INCLUDE
The include option tells the entity populator and pruner to include specific named child collections and exclude the rest. Invalid attributes are ignored. This option has no effect on attributes that are not child collections.

This option is one of the 3 pruning options. If no pruning options are specified, the default is to return whatever the server loaded in the course of doing business.

See Also:
DEPTH, SELECT, Constant Field Values

SELECT

static final java.lang.String SELECT
The select option tells the entity populator and pruner to include specific named attributes and exclude the rest. Invalid attributes are ignored. This option has no effect on attributes that are child collections.

This option is one of the 3 pruning options. If no pruning options are specified, the default is to return whatever the server loaded in the course of doing business.

See Also:
DEPTH, INCLUDE, Constant Field Values

PAGE

static final java.lang.String PAGE
The page option tells find operations to return a page other than the first one (the default). Pages are 1 based.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PER_PAGE

static final java.lang.String PER_PAGE
The per_page option tells find operations to limit the number of rows returned on each page. The default should be all rows, but that behavior may vary in each application.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ORDER

static final java.lang.String ORDER
The order option tells find operations to sort the results by the given attribute list. To sort in descending order, add :desc to the attribute name. Passing invalid attributes will cause errors.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
